Definition: An abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA) is a bulging or dilation of the abdominal aorta, the largest blood vessel in the body.
Achilles tendonitis is an overuse injury causing pain and inflammation of the Achilles tendon.
Symptoms: Pain along the back of the heel

Definition: Acne is a common skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become clogged with oil and dead skin cells.
An acoustic neuroma is a benign tumor that develops on the vestibulocochlear nerve, which connects the inner ear to the brain.
Causes: Exact cause unknown; often associated with genetic conditions like Neurofibromatosis type II

Definition: Acute kidney injury is a sudden episode of kidney failure or kidney damage that occurs within a few hours or a few days.
Causes: Decreased blood flow to the kidneys

Definition: Acute lymphocytic leukemia is a type of cancer that affects the blood and bone marrow, characterized by the overproduction of immature white blood cells.
Causes: Exact cause unknown; genetic mutations may play a role

Definition: Acute myeloid leukemia is a type of cancer that starts in the blood-forming cells of the bone marrow and invades the blood.
Acute respiratory distress syndrome is a severe lung condition that occurs when fluid builds up in the air sacs of the lungs.
Adamantinoma is a rare bone tumor that typically occurs in the long bones, particularly the tibia.
Causes: Exact cause unknown; may be related to genetic factors
Symptoms: Pain and swelling at the tumor site

Definition: Addison's disease is a disorder that occurs when the adrenal glands do not produce enough hormones.
Adult congenital heart disease refers to heart defects that are present at birth but may not be diagnosed until adulthood.
Airway stenosis is a narrowing of the airway that can lead to breathing difficulties.
Treatment: Surgical intervention to widen the airway

Definition: Alcoholism is a chronic disease characterized by an inability to control or stop drinking despite negative consequences.
Allergic rhinitis is an allergic reaction that causes sneezing, congestion, and other symptoms.
Allergic vasculitis is an inflammation of the blood vessels caused by an allergic reaction.
Causes: Allergic reactions to medications or infections

Definition: Allergies are immune system reactions to substances that are typically harmless.
Alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency is a genetic disorder that can lead to lung and liver disease.
Alport syndrome is a genetic condition characterized by kidney disease, hearing loss, and eye abnormalities.
Alveolar soft-part sarcoma is a rare type of cancer that typically occurs in soft tissues.
Causes: Exact cause unknown; may involve genetic mutations

Definition: Alzheimer's disease is a progressive neurological disorder that causes memory loss and cognitive decline.
Amblyopia, commonly known as lazy eye, is a vision development disorder where an eye fails to achieve normal visual acuity.
Amenorrhea is the absence of menstruation in a woman of reproductive age.
Amyloidosis is a rare disease that occurs when amyloid proteins build up in organs and tissues.
Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis is a progressive neurodegenerative disease that affects nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord.
Causes: Exact cause unknown; genetic factors may play a role

Definition: An anal abscess is a painful condition that occurs when a cavity filled with pus forms near the anus.
Treatment: Incision and drainage of the abscess

Definition: Anal cancer is a rare type of cancer that occurs in the tissues of the anus.
An anal fissure is a small tear in the lining of the anus that can cause pain and bleeding.
Anaphylaxis is a severe, potentially life-threatening allergic reaction.
Anemia is a condition in which you lack enough healthy red blood cells to carry adequate oxygen to your body's tissues.
An aneurysm is an abnormal bulge in the wall of a blood vessel.
Angioedema is a condition characterized by swelling in the deeper layers of the skin, often around the eyes and lips.
Symptoms: Swelling of the face, lips, or throat

Definition: Angiosarcoma is a rare cancer that originates in the blood vessels or lymph vessels.
Causes: Exact cause unknown; may be related to radiation exposure or chronic lymphedema

Definition: An ACL injury is a tear or sprain of the anterior cruciate ligament, a key ligament that helps stabilize the knee.
Causes: Sudden stops or changes in direction
Symptoms: Popping sound at the time of injury

Definition: Anterior knee pain is a common condition that causes pain in the front of the knee.
Aortic coarctation is a congenital condition characterized by a narrowing of the aorta.
Symptoms: High blood pressure in the arms
Low blood pressure in the legs

Definition: Aortic dissection is a serious condition in which the inner layer of the aorta tears.
Symptoms: Sudden severe chest or back pain

Definition: Aortic ulcers are lesions that develop in the aorta, often due to atherosclerosis.
Aortic valve regurgitation is a condition in which the aortic valve does not close tightly, allowing blood to flow backward into the heart.
Aortic valve stenosis is a narrowing of the aortic valve opening, which restricts blood flow from the heart.
Aplastic anemia is a rare condition where the bone marrow fails to produce enough blood cells.
Arrhythmia is an irregular heartbeat that can be too fast, too slow, or erratic.
Arrhythmogenic cardiomyopathy is a type of heart disease that causes arrhythmias and can lead to heart failure.
An arterial embolism occurs when a blood clot or other debris travels through the bloodstream and lodges in an artery.
Arterial insufficiency is a condition where the arteries cannot supply enough blood to the tissues.
Symptoms: Coldness in the lower leg or foot
Weak or absent pulse in the legs

Definition: Arteriosclerosis is the thickening and hardening of the arterial walls.
Treatment: Medications to lower blood pressure and cholesterol

Definition: Arteriovenous malformations are abnormal connections between arteries and veins.
Arthritis is inflammation of one or more joints, causing pain and stiffness.
Asbestos lung disease refers to lung conditions caused by inhaling asbestos fibers.
Ascites is the accumulation of fluid in the abdominal cavity.
Asherman syndrome is a condition characterized by the formation of scar tissue in the uterus.
Asperger syndrome is a developmental disorder that affects social interaction and communication.
Causes: Exact cause unknown; genetic factors may play a role

Definition: Aspergillosis is an infection caused by the Aspergillus fungus.
Aspiration pneumonia is an infection that occurs when food, liquid, or vomit is inhaled into the lungs.
Aspirin exacerbated respiratory disease is a condition characterized by asthma and nasal polyps that worsen with aspirin use.
Causes: Sensitivity to aspirin and other non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs)

Definition: Asthma is a chronic lung condition that causes difficulty breathing due to inflammation and narrowing of the airways.
Ataxia is a neurological sign consisting of lack of voluntary coordination of muscle movements.
Atelectasis is the partial or complete collapse of a lung or lobe of a lung.
Atherosclerosis is a condition in which fatty deposits build up on the artery walls.
Athlete's foot is a fungal infection that usually begins between the toes.
Atrial fibrillation is an irregular and often rapid heart rate that can lead to blood clots, stroke, and other heart-related complications.
An atrial septal defect is a congenital heart defect characterized by a hole in the wall between the two upper chambers of the heart.
Atypical parkinsonism refers to a group of disorders that cause movement problems similar to Parkinson's disease.
Atypical parkinsonism syndromes are a group of disorders that present with parkinsonian symptoms but have different underlying causes.
Avascular necrosis is a condition that occurs when blood flow to a bone is reduced, leading to bone death.
Axillary nerve disorder is a condition that affects the axillary nerve, leading to weakness and numbness in the shoulder.
